instruction: Provide input to the following instructions to test the GPT model.
input:
Instruction: Summarise the given article.
Input:
Human intelligence has fascinated scientists who have sought to understand its nature and capabilities for centuries. Advances in technology have enabled us to create powerful AI systems that can learn to perform certain tasks on their own. Recent breakthroughs in machine learning have enabled their application to real-world tasks, such as recognizing objects in images and even automating some aspects of decision-making.
output: <noinput> The article discussed the long-standing interest of scientists in human intelligence, and how advances in technology have allowed us to create AI systems that are capable of learning and performing complex tasks, such as image recognition and decision-making. Recent breakthroughs in machine learning have enabled these AI systems to be applied to real-world tasks.

instruction: Connect the given sentences to form a declarative statement.
input: Humans have the capacity to learn. AI can be programmed.
output: Humans have the capacity to learn while AI can be programmed.

instruction: Write an email given the subject and the task.
input:
Subject: Follow-up on our meeting
Task: Remind the team about the actions agreed upon in the meeting
output:
Dear team, 

I am writing this email to follow up on our meeting earlier today. I want to remind you all of the actions that were agreed upon. First and foremost, we discussed starting our new task force and assigning roles to each member. Please make sure that you have selected your role, and distributed the tasks accordingly. Secondly, we also discussed our timeline for delivering the project. Our deadline is in six weeks, so please ensure that you are on track. Lastly, we discussed budgeting. I have included a budget template in this email, which should help you understand what has been agreed upon in terms of expenses. 

Please let me know if you have any questions or if you need any clarification. 

Best, 

[name]

instruction: Classify whether the following sentence is a lie or not. Output: "lie" or "not lie".
input: I never eat dessert after meals.
output: not lie

instruction: Compose a haiku about the theme darkness.
output:
Darkness descends upon us 
A cloak of night obscures light 
A silence blanketed by dusk.

instruction: Write two words that rhyme with "moon".
output: loon, boon

instruction: Describe the process of decision tree learning.
output: Decision tree learning is a supervised machine learning technique used to create a predictive model. It is used to map observations about an item onto a predefined set of classes. The decision tree is generated by splitting a dataset into subsets based on the outcome of previous tests. Each subsequent split is based on whether a condition is true or false and each of these sub-splitting will produce a branch in the decision tree. In order to determine the best split, a measure of impurity such as entropy or Gini is used to measure the data at each step. At the final step, when all of the splits have been made and all of the conditions have been evaluated, the final output of a decision tree is a collection of rules that can be used for prediction.

instruction: Explain why the following could represent a potential conflict.
output: The potential conflict in this scenario is the disagreement between the individual and the government on the amount of taxes to be paid. The individual may believe that the amount of taxes requested is excessive, while the government may disagree and insist on the payment of the amount it has requested.

instruction: Describe the effect of the Great Plague of 1665 on England.
output: The Great Plague of 1665 had a devastating effect on England. It caused widespread death and illness, devastated the economy, and caused a deep disruption to all aspects of life. The estimated death toll was between 75,000 and 200,000 people.

instruction: Describe a scene in which motivation to complete a task is lacking.
output: A scene where motivation to complete a task is lacking could involve someone staring blankly at their computer screen with their hands in their lap, feeling overwhelmed and unsure of how to move forward. The room could be quiet and filled with an ambience of resignation and defeat.

instruction: For the following sentence, point out the grammatical mistakes and suggest a fix for each mistake.
output: The sentence contains a factual error (there is not three mistakes), a subject-verb agreement error (there is instead of there are), and a number agreement error (three instead of two). A corrected version of the sentence would be: "There are two mistakes."

instruction: Compare two products and provide the pros and cons of each product.
input: Comparing the iPhone X and Samsung S9
output:
The iPhone X is the latest and greatest model from Apple, and it comes with a sleek design and fast performing tech. It has gesture control, facial recognition, and wireless charging capabilities. It has a bright, 5.8 inch OLED screen, and a longer lasting battery than the iPhone 8. 

The Samsung S9 also has great specs and features. It has a 5.8 inch OLED screen, and marked improvements over the S8 include expanded RAM, faster processing speeds, and improved dual lens rear-facing camera. It also supports fast charging, has an IP68 rating for water resistance, and has 16GB and 64GB storage options. 

Pros of the iPhone X: 
- Sleek design
- Face and Gesture recognition technology 
- Wireless charging capabilities
- 5.8 inch, bright OLED screen
- Longer lasting battery

Pros of the Samsung S9:
- 5.8 inch OLED screen
- Expanded RAM and faster processing speeds
- Improved dual lens rear-facing camera
- Fast charging support
- IP68 rating for water resistance
- 16GB and 64GB storage options

instruction: Given a sequence of numbers, identify any patterns or trends and make a prediction.

instruction: Given a user query, provide the appropriate formal definition.
output: A polygon is a closed plane figure bounded by three or more straight sides which are equal and also all internal angles are equal.

instruction: Take a photograph of something from an unusual perspective.
output: A photo taken from an unusual perspective may be a close-up shot of a very small object or far away shot of a very large object, usually from an angle that is not typical in everyday view.

instruction: Explain why the following statement is true: A privilege is a right that is granted to some people and not to others.
output: A privilege is a special right that is granted to some people, but not to all. It is typically exclusive to a certain social, economic, or political class, such as the wealthy or the elite. Privileges can include benefits or access to certain resources that are unavailable to others. Since these privileges are not available to everyone, those who are privileged are able to gain advantage and benefit from the inequities in a system.

instruction: Given a description of an animal, identify what type of animal it is.
input: This animal has a long, flexible neck and narrow, pointed bill. It has long legs and webbed feet, and it feeds mainly on fish.
output: This animal is a heron.
